problem.markdown:
1. In proteins the chiral center is present at: () Nitrogen of amino group. () Carbon of carboxyl group. (x) Alpha carbon. () Oxygen in carbonyl group.
2. CD signals in the far UV region(180-250nm) are helpful for secondary structure analysis due to (x) Peptide bond absorption. () Aromatic side chain absorption. () Disulphide bond absorption. () None of the above are correct
3. CD signals in the near UV region(250-320 nm) provide tertiray structural information due to? () Peptide bond absorption. (x) Aromatic side chain absorption. () Disulphide bond absorption. ()All of the above are correct
4. Electronic transition taking place at 220nm (x) n - π*. () π- π*. () Both of the above. () None of the above are correct.
5. Electronic transition taking place at 190nm () n - π*. (x) π- π*. () Both A and B. () None of the above.
6. The π--> π* transition shows negative peak in which of the following secondary structures () Alpha helix. (x) Beta sheet. () Random coil. () None of the above.
problem.p: 1. In proteins the chiral center is present at:
2. CD signals in the far UV region(180-250nm) are helpful for secondary structure analysis due to

choicegroup.choice: None of the above are correct

problem.p: 3. CD signals in the near UV region(250-320 nm) provide tertiray structural information due to?

choicegroup.choice: All of the above are correct
None of the above are correct.

problem.p: 6. The π--> π* transition shows negative peak in which of the following secondary structures
